intro: Excoecaria leucogyna, commonly known as the white-leaf croton, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking white and green variegated leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
